name: It's "Curtains" For You! Online Quiz | Musicals | 10 Questions

questions.text: The composer/lyricist team of Kander and Ebb wrote the majority of "Curtains". Who helped write lyrics after Peter Stone passed away?
questions.explanation:
Rupert Holmes.

	Rupert Holmes helped with the lyrics after Fred Ebb passed away in 2004. The late Peter Stone created the concept for the musical and worked on the show until his death in 2003.

questions.text: According to Cioffi in the musical "Curtains", who has been whacked?
questions.explanation:
A Soprano.

	"A soprano's been whacked!" proclaims Cioffi, the detective who investigates the murder central to the plot of "Curtains". The line was used at the 2007 Annual Tony Awards to introduce a number from the show.

questions.text: In which town does the show "Curtains" take place?
questions.explanation:
Boston.

	The show is set during 1959 in Boston. Lieutenant Frank Cioffi of the Boston Police Department is called upon to solve a murder, and also gets romantically involved with one of the cast members.

questions.text: Which righteous tale is the basis for the show within "Curtains"?
questions.explanation:
The Legend of Robin Hood.

	"Robbin' Hood of the Old West" is a gloriously horrible show whose leading lady is killed on opening night. Cioffi is called in to solve the murder, setting the basis for the show.

questions.text: Aaron Fox is divorced from which other character in the musical "Curtains"?
questions.explanation:
Georgia Hendricks.

	After Cranshaw's death, Georgia is picked to take her role in the musical. She and Fox are divorced, although he has fallen in love with her once again.

questions.text: Although it moved to Broadway in 2007, where did the show "Curtains" have its world premiere?
questions.explanation:
Los Angeles.

	"Curtains" opened in July 2006 at the Ahmanson Theatre in Los Angeles, California. Retaining several key cast members, it moved to Broadway and opened there in March of 2007.

questions.text: Bambi Bernet is the daughter of which character in the show "Curtains"?
questions.explanation:
Carmen Bernstein.

	Bambi is an ambitious chorus girl who edited her last name to make it more memorable. The role was originally played by Megan Sikora.

questions.text: Which character in the musical "Curtains" does not sing in the number "In The Same Boat"?
questions.explanation:
Aaron Fox.

	Aaron Fox, originally played on Broadway by Jason Danieley, is one half of the songwriting team behind "Robbin' Hood of the Old West". He falls back in love with Georgia Hendricks, from whom he is divorced.

questions.text: In "I Miss The Music" in the show "Curtains" Aaron claims that one needs to stay away from love and life in regards to songwriting.
questions.explanation:
True.

	"Well don't talk about loveOr you'll have to say "fits like a glove"Or "As certain as push comes to shove"You will pine for the woman you're constantly thinking of."

questions.text: In "Coffee Shop Nights" in the show "Curtains" with which acting group does Cioffi perform?
questions.explanation:
The Swallow Street Players.

	"The life that I leadThat's a little bit grayThere are plenty of low daysAnd not many heightsMostly lunch counter morningsAnd coffee shop nights."
